image.altText: police and ambulance officers in a street at a crash site

props.synopsis: A person has been hit by a car and killed as people were making their way to work and school in the central Victorian city this morning.

title.children: Breaking: Pedestrian hit and killed on busy road near Bendigo school

image.altText: Parent walks children in school uniform into Spring Mountain State School, west of Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Principals in Victoria already have the power to ban aggressive or violent parents from school grounds, but the state government is looking to apply the power to parents' behaviour on social media.

title.children: School principals' power to ban aggressive parents set to increase

image.altText: Playground equipment viewed through a cyclone fence in sunshine.

props.synopsis: The government says about 40 Victorian workers retained their Working with Children Check despite being deemed an unacceptable risk to children by the education department.

title.children: Dozens of blacklisted Victorian workers stripped of children check

image.altText: Man in red sweater, cap and sunglasses standing in front of construction works on the Western Highway.

props.synopsis: In regional Victoria, potholes are not being fixed and major rural road projects have stalled, despite the loss of life from accidents.

title.children: Victoria's most dangerous roads are in regional areas

image.altText: A man wearing black posing for a photo.

props.synopsis: Deep underground in an old gold mine in regional Victoria, scientists enter a worldwide race to understand the composition of dark matter.

title.children: Inside the experiment that could change our understanding of the universe

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A teenager who allegedly posted terrorism propaganda online and made threats to kill has been denied bail.

title.children: Teenager who allegedly pledged allegiance to Islamic State denied bail

image.altText: A photo of a white tow truck carrying a white truck, with a yellow and green flag across the body of the car

props.synopsis: Hundreds of rapid-response fire vehicles are off the road ahead of bushfire season, prompting fears local brigades will have to pick up the slack.

title.children: Almost 350 rapid-response fire trucks grounded in Victoria due to faults

image.altText: Part of a house on it's side between other properties.

props.synopsis: A major inquiry into the disastrous January landslide on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula concludes the incident was caused by a burst main that gushed water for months beforehand.

title.children: Burst water main caused landslide that toppled luxury home, report finds

image.altText: A baby in a white top with cartoon animals on it lies on a rug on the floor with her fist against her mouth.

props.synopsis: The death of a 15-week-old baby in an unlicensed home day care in Victoria’s north-west is among more than two dozen disturbing childcare incidents recorded in government documents unearthed by the ABC.

title.children: Infant's death in illegal child care kept hidden from public

image.altText: Australian agribusiness Elders

props.synopsis: The consumer watchdog has given the go-ahead for Elders to acquire its competitor, Delta, but it must sell six Delta stores in WA to improve competition.

title.children: ACCC approves Elders' $475m acquisition of agribusiness rival Delta

image.altText: Mitch Brown speaking to the Daily Aus.

props.synopsis: After coming out, Mitch Brown became an unofficial spokesperson for queer issues in the AFL. While that experience has been overwhelmingly positive, it's also come with an onslaught of hate.

title.children: 'Not shying away': Mitch Brown on the hate that's come with coming out

image.altText: Leek Aleer with his palms facing the sky

props.synopsis: St Kilda officially adds Liam Ryan in a trade with West Coast as the AFL world continues to react to the Saints' stunning decision to pull out of a move for Leek Aleer. Here's how day four of the AFL trade period panned out.

title.children: Saints under fire as brutal trade backflip leaves young defender 'shattered'

image.altText: Nelson Asofa-Solomona passes to his left for the Melbourne Storm during the 2025 NRL season.

props.synopsis: Melbourne will clear Nelson Asofa-Solomona's salary from its cap after the powerful front-rower was granted a release from the final two years of his deal with the club.

title.children: Storm veteran granted immediate release from NRL contract

image.altText: An illustration of a young person in court

props.synopsis: The Victorian government defends the strength of its bail laws, after the opposition criticised a recently updated guide instructing bail decision-makers to release an alleged child offender "whenever possible".

title.children: Victorian government defends bail laws as opposition criticises new judicial guidance

image.altText: A woman with tied back brown hair in a brown top looks upwards as she is helped out of a white van by three men dressed in blue.

props.synopsis: In sentencing the triple-murderer, Justice Christopher Beale found there was a substantial chance she would remain in solitary confinement for years, which prosecutors dispute.

title.children: Prosecutors say judge 'erred' in giving Erin Patterson parole chance

image.altText: The Victoria Police insignia on the sleeve of an officer's shirt.

props.synopsis: Police are alerting hundreds of accused sexual offenders that their cases may be compromised by the work of a digital forensics officer based in Bendigo.

title.children: Hundreds of Victorian sex crime cases being re-examined by police

image.altText: A woman in a black dress and a blue blazer stands near a microphone, while two people behind her look at her

props.synopsis: A mass email from a Liberal MP wrongly congratulates many people across northern Victoria on becoming new Australian citizens.

title.children: Liberal MP sends email wrongly congratulating people for becoming citizens

image.altText: Exterior of aged care facility in regional Victoria.

props.synopsis: An aged care facility in western Victoria receives an "unprecedented" donation that will allow it to enhance the lives of residents living with dementia.

title.children: Family donates $1.7m to reshape dementia care in Victorian town

image.altText: Close up photo of a woman

props.synopsis: A 34-year-old Shepparton woman has been jailed for 13 years after dousing another woman with petrol and setting her on fire during a dispute over an e-scooter.

title.children: Woman jailed for 13 years for setting rival alight in e-scooter fight

image.altText: a domed camera is mounted on a street sign

props.synopsis: The City of Melbourne is set to vote on a new plan that would see more privately owned CCTV cameras feeding into the city's security network and staff able to access the footage to investigate local law breaches.

title.children: Melbourne council staff to be given surveillance powers under draft plans

image.altText: A man in an orange robe and red beanie arriving at court.

props.synopsis: The head monk of a Buddhist temple, Naotunne Vijitha, has denied sexually assaulting six girls at the temple in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Buddhist monk sexually assaulted girls at Melbourne temple, trial told

image.altText: Geelong Cats players run through the banner at the AFL grand final.

props.synopsis: The AFL fines Geelong $77,500 for failing to disclose third-party agreements with players over a six-year period.

title.children: Geelong Cats fined by AFL over third-party disclosures

image.altText: Medicinal cannabis plantations close up.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man found guilty of insider trading during a $20 million capital raise by a medicinal cannabis company has been ordered to pay more than $225,000.

title.children: Man sentenced, fined over medicinal cannabis company insider trading

image.altText: Oscar Allen of the Eagles walking with his head down, hands on hips, looking disappointed

props.synopsis: Oscar Allen's move to Brisbane is official as West Coast finds out what compensation it will receive for losing its captain. Here's how day three of the AFL trade period panned out.

title.children: Lions land West Coast captain, giving Eagles second pick in draft

image.altText: An underground rail station.

props.synopsis: Victorian Premier Jacinta Allan says Melbourne's Metro Tunnel, which has been plagued by delays and cost blowouts, will open before Christmas, with construction of the final two stations now complete.

title.children: Melbourne Metro Tunnel to open in early December

image.altText: A render of a proposed 17-storey community and affordable housing tower in Greensborough,

props.synopsis: A Victorian housing charity awarded more than $200 million in taxpayer funds for a proposed 17-storey tower is controlled by a for-profit investment firm, the ABC can reveal.

title.children: Charity run by investment firm linked to 17-storey suburban tower

image.altText: A group of four parents standing in front of a brick building

props.synopsis: Parents of children with disability can miss out on social support, but a Victorian physiotherapist hopes to change that.

title.children: Social group helping parents of kids with disability find connection

image.altText: What looks like an authentic Victorian drivers licence with the name Stuart Parker and a Ramsay Street address.

props.synopsis: Neighbours fans rush to Melbourne op shops after 40 years of props, furniture and Ramsay Street relics were donated to charities.

title.children: 'It's a storyline from Neighbours': Op shops serve up a slice of TV history

image.altText: A sign that says "for lease".

props.synopsis: Median rental prices have risen to more than $700 per week for the first time, according to Cotality's Quarterly Rental Review.

title.children: Increasing rent driving people away from employment

image.altText: Graffiti on a billboard reading 'Glory to Hamas'

props.synopsis: Political leaders have condemned the painting of a pro-Hamas slogan on a Melbourne billboard as Australia's Jewish community commemorates the October 7 terrorist attack.

title.children: Pro-Hamas graffiti appears across Melbourne on anniversary of October 7 attack

image.altText: Jaffles on a tray covered in sugar, with milk and coffee.

props.synopsis: An oatmeal-filled jaffle made by a Melbourne food stylist and flavoured with Bundaberg Rum and bananas wins over judges in Scotland.

title.children: Australian woman wins World Porridge Making Championship in Scotland

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Doxed man petitions to have sovereign citizens declared domestic terrorists

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

props.synopsis: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.

title.children: Coroner's warning on crash that killed adult and three teens

image.altText: An adult whale and a whale calf breaching.

props.synopsis: Once hunted almost to extinction, the population of humpback whales currently migrating down Australia's east coast has bounced back and is now greater than before whaling.

title.children: These whales were hunted to 150 individuals. Now there are 50,000 of them

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

title.children: Rise in Victoria's prisoner numbers outpaces population growth
